config.comments: Checks for unique key attribute against a list of attributes already seen and only outputs new pastes. Since we receive metadata on the last 100 pastes every 60 seconds and far less than 100 are created in that time period, we will receive a fair amount of duplicates.
Creates attributes from values extracted from the json response.

Extracts text matching the custom regex you configure and creates an attribute with the results. Also routes the paste to the 'matched' output. Content that does not trigger on regex gets routed to 'unmatched' (which is currently terminated in this config)

entry.key: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern

value.name: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern

entry.key: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

value.name: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

entry.key: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern
Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

config.comments: Call the URL in the 'scrape_url' attribute to retrieve the paste content. Returns the result.

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute

value.name: Max Length To Put In Attribute

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute

config.comments: Catch all to complete the flow.
Following the Pastebin recommendations for API use, we slow down how many pastes we scrape to 1 per sec.

Calls Pastebin scraping API every 60 seconds and returns metadata for the 100 most recent pastes.
IMPORTANT: You must have a Pastebin pro account with the public IP address of the NiFi server white-listed for this to work.
Splits API json response into individual records.
